result.execSummary:
The defendant Deveone Romell Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, pay DNA surcharge.
Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge. To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance due at the end of Extended Supervision will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count two.  Credit for 94 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obtain high school diploma, GED or HSED.
Maintain full time employment, full time school or part time employment and school.

No alcohol or controlled substances.
No contact with coactor Prince Antonio Gibbs Jr.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.   Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Defendant advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms; also advised he is unable to vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one.  Credit for 94 days.

Back to Court.

records.descr: Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the state, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Latreese Peterson.

AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 51 MONTHS, concurrent to Count 2.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 15 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 36 MONTHS, with credit for 94 days.  Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

AS TO COUNT 2: The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 51 MONTHS, concurrent to Count 1.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 15 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 36 MONTHS, with credit for 94 days.  Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Obtain high school diploma, GED or HSED.
- Maintain full-time employment, full-time school or part-time employment and school.
- AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety with random urine screens.
- No alcohol or controlled substances.
- No contact with co-acter, Prince Antonio Gibbs, Jr.
- Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
- Restitution is set at zero.

Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, to paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b).  Any remaining balance due at the end of extended supervision will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.

Defendant advised of appeal rights.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Defendant Deveone Romell Peterson in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Defendant Deveone Romell Peterson in custody.  Daniel J Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for plea and sentencing hearing.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.  Negotiations placed on the record by the state.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a judgment of conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

AS TO COUNT 3: Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the state, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney J. Dennis Thornton in court, defendant Deveone Romell Peterson not in court, in custody.  Daniel j Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel waives defendant's appearance for purposes of today's hearing.
Defense counsel requests adjournment for plea hearing.
Court orders case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 28.

DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing. 
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Deveone Romell Peterson in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Defendant Deveone Romell Peterson in custody.  Ron Dague for Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Raquel S., Smaquila J., Prince G., or Lee V.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Deveone Romell Peterson in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Deveone Romell Peterson in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
